ConversationAction.text: We still have to take over the last station your crew was sent to before we can plan an attack on the next one.

You decided to use the radio Kumo gave you and call her to see if she would answer. It did not take long before you heard a familiar voice answering the call. “Affirmative. This is Captain Kumo of the Separatists Vessel “Seawolf”. State your business.”
“Ah… I was wondering when you would be calling. I assume you called to collect the favor I owe?”
“Right, to business then. As promised, I will give you anything as long as it is in my capability to acquire them. What is it that you want?”
“That’s not an issue for me. I can transfer over 3,500mks to your wallet.”
“I am sending the money over. Check and see if you receive it.”

“Alright, now that everything is settled, as much as I like to keep in touch with you, it’s time for us to part ways. I rather not have any issues resurfacing from this incident and cutting contact is the best for all of us. Farewell my friend and have a safe trip. Oh but one more thing... The radio will self-destruct in a second. I do suggest dropping it.”

Option.text: “Come on, after all the effort I went through for you? You can at least give me more than that.”

ConversationAction.text: “Hm… I can understand the troubles you had to go through to help me… Very well, I’ll give you 4,000mks instead. Check and see if you receive it.”
“I believe I am already quite generous with what I offer. I will not give anything more than that. Now check and see if you receive it.”
“Guns eh? That’s not a problem, I’ll offer you 3 courses and in each course, choose the weapons that best suits you.”

“For the appetizer, we have 2 sets of revolver armed with depleted fuel rounds capable of irradiating your targets. If you need a gun with a rapid fire rate, we have a SMG with both normal and depleted fuel magazines. Or maybe you prefer something that gives a punch? Like a riot shotgun loaded with 12 gauge shells?”

“Good choice. Onwards to the main course… We have an assault rifle made by the Separatists with each magazine containing 20 rounds, good for raiding outposts as long as you can handle the weapon. If you want something robust, an auto shotgun pack with explosive slugs might be up to your taste. Or maybe you want something impactful? Like a grenade launcher with 40mm grenades?”

“And lastly, the dessert… We have the classic boarding axe, able to deal devastating strikes against armored creatures and walls. Or if you want something small and swift, may I suggest a dementonite knife. This knife is infused with the alien materials called dementonite clusters. It’s very quick, deadly and tends to drive your opponent insane. "
"If you don’t like that, I could also offer europan handshake. Coated with morbusine poison, a few stabs with this knife will leave your enemy poisoned and gasping for air.”
“Consider it done. I have sent the orders to the outpost manager. Head to the administrator room and talk to the person in-charge, they will pass you the weapons.”

“Alright, now that everything is settled, as much as I like to keep in touch with you, it’s time for us to part ways. I rather not have any issues resurfacing from this incident and cutting contact is the best for all of us. Farewell my friend and have a safe trip. Oh but one more thing... The radio will self-destruct in a second. I do suggest dropping it.”
"Hey you! You must be the crew Kumo mentioned about... She said you ordered some weapons. They're in the duffle bags, so be sure to take them!"
“Oh! I almost forgot! Here’s the melee weapon you requested too!”

Option.text: “Come on, where are the big guns? Surely you can offer them to me…”

ConversationAction.text: “You mean a high caliber machine gun capable of firing 100 bullets in 12 seconds? Hm… I can certainly get that weapon for you but just letting you know, you need to know your weapon handling in order to use that beast of a gun.”
“Not sure what you are talking about… And even if I do, I wouldn’t offer such a deadly weapon to anyone.”
"I should be able to recruit two seamen to your crew. Tell me, for your first crewmate, what types of personnel are you looking for?"
"And your second crewmate?"
"Consider it done. I have sent the necessary documents to the HR department, they will be sending two new members to your crew. Do expect to see them soon."

“Alright, now that everything is settled, as much as I like to keep in touch with you, it’s time for us to part ways. I rather not have any issues resurfacing from this incident and cutting contact is the best for all of us. Farewell my friend and have a safe trip. Oh but one more thing... The radio will self-destruct in a second. I do suggest dropping it.”
"And your second crewmate?"
"I should be able to recruit two seamen to your crew. Tell me, for your first crewmate, what types of personnel are you looking for?"

Option.text: “You. I want you on my crew.”

ConversationAction.text: She chuckles, “A little too late for that, don’t you think? I’ve already submitted the documents to take over this crew, I can’t leave them since I am the captain of my submarine. However, I can help you recruit two crewmates of your choice if you are in desperate need of helping hands.”

Option.text: “Yes, I like to have more crewmates.”

ConversationAction.text: "Okay. So tell me, for your first crewmate, what types of personnel are you looking for?"
"Okay. So tell me, for your first crewmate, what types of personnel are you looking for?"
“Huh? Then what is the purpose of this call?” She asks, a little bewilder by your action.

Option.text: “I thought we could have a conversation.”

ConversationAction.text: “A conversation? Aren’t you an amusing one? I guess I do not mind having a talk… What is it that you like to ask?”
“Well… With my new promotion as a captain and the death of my old captain, I am definitely doing a lot better. Thank you for asking.” She replies casually.

Option.text: “Look, I know Captain Smith wasn’t a traitor. Tell me… Why did you want him dead?”
“Do you have any interesting stories throughout your travels?”
“Look, I know Captain Smith wasn’t a traitor. Tell me… Why did you want him dead?”

ConversationAction.text: “Since you found out the truth, I guess there is no need for me to pretend in front of you. There are two reasons why I wanted him dead. One was because he always placed his crewmates in danger. To him, the life of a few people was nothing compared to him getting his power and knowledge.”
“The second reason was because I wanted my revenge on him for killing my former captain… For killing someone who raised me when I was young… Someone who I saw as a fatherly figure.”
“I’ll be honest, I was not expecting you to understand my situation. Nonetheless I am grateful for your help and I will return the favor to the best of my ability, so that we are even.”

Option.text: “Do you have any interesting stories throughout your travels?”
“It still doesn’t feel right to kill someone for the sake of avenging someone else…”

ConversationAction.text: “I don’t expect you to understand what I did. However, I do appreciate your help in killing Captain Smith for me. Therefore, I will return the debt as promised.”

Option.text: “Do you have any interesting stories throughout your travels?”
“Do you have any interesting stories throughout your travels?”

ConversationAction.text: “A conversation? Aren’t you an amusing one? I guess I do not mind having a talk… What is it that you like to ask?”
“Well… With my new promotion as a captain and the death of my old captain, I am definitely doing a lot better. Thank you for asking.” She replies casually.

Option.text: “Tell me, how did you find out that your captain was a traitor?”
“Do you have any interesting stories throughout your travels?”
“Tell me, how did you find out that your captain was a traitor?”

ConversationAction.text: “I have my own ways of finding out the truth… Plus being the second in command, you would have to follow him around and obey his orders. Eventually he lets his guard down and you’ll see his true colors.”

Option.text: “Do you have any interesting stories throughout your travels?”
“Do you have any interesting stories throughout your travels?”

ConversationAction.text: “Hm… I do have a story or two I can share… Especially this one, we were doing a normal escort mission just like any other day. All of a sudden, we were ambushed by a Coalition submarine. I don’t know how they managed to board our submarine but I was one of the first in line to defend the oncoming assault. I managed to kill a few of the Coalition soldiers before they incapacitated me. In the end, I was captured by the Coalition.”

“I was brought in and forced to stand in front of the Coalition council… I must say, it felt like I was being watched by a pack of hungry mudraptors. They wanted my execution but I negotiated with them. In exchange for my freedom, I was to give up some valuable information about the Separatists. So, I managed to talk my way through by giving up non-essential information. From there, they released me and made me work under a Coalition submarine called Sorrowful.”

Option.text: “How was it like working in a Coalition submarine?”

ConversationAction.text: “Horrible. The captain did not care for his crew and was fixated on following the Coalition laws. If one was to break any law, the punishment was death or something worse.”

“I remember there was this mechanic… I believe his name was Shepard… He stole something from an outpost and got caught by a security officer. When the captain was informed of the news, he literally had one of the doctors amputate that person’s hand for his crime. The poor guy ended up going mentally insane after losing his hand.”

“You think this would intimidate people from trying to do anything suspicious. Well, it worked on his crew but it didn’t work on me. For someone like me who is an expert at stealing, I know how to steal without getting caught. Hell, I even stole a few bottles of expensive alcohol from the captain himself!”

Option.text: “Nice. How about security? Were they any good?”

ConversationAction.text: “Nope. They were god damn incompetent. There was one incident where I was in the reactor room when a mudraptor broke in. I fled towards the nearest room for safety and the moment I opened the door, a coalition security officer shot off my right leg!"

"I shit you not, I instantly fell onto the floor and didn’t even know that I lost a leg until a medic pointed it out. I was then dragged to medbay to get treated… I could barely remember the rest as I slipped in and out of consciousness.”

“Now that I think about it, I wasn’t really lucky when I was in that crew. I was in so many accidents that I lost count… I actually felt bad for the medics, they had to patch me up after every accident. In fact, I even got to know one of the medics personally. Her name was Dr. Pierce… She had a cold demeanor but always treated me nicely.”

“Even when she found out I was once a Separatist, she never really held hostility towards me. I kind of wish I could meet her again or if I could, I like to bring her over towards the Separatists. At last, we stand on different sides and I bet it’s best if I don’t find her…”
“Haha, look at me, rambling on and on about the past... It’s best if I stop and get back to what you really wanted.”

Option.text: “No, I want to hear more stories.”

ConversationAction.text: “I would love to share more but I have matters to attend to. So sadly I can’t keep this up.”

Option.text: “I’m joking, I am here to collect what was owed.”

ConversationAction.text: " As much as I love the silliness, I would rather we not waste anymore time.”
